analysis.Summary: Defines the 'auth' route module for the authentication section of the Vue application: sets up a parent layout, child routes (sign in, sign up, reset password, etc.), associated components, route guards and metadata.
analysis.Purpose: Configure and export authentication-related routes for the Vue Router, including dynamic component loading, route metadata (titles) and middleware guards.

Components.name: auth
Components.responsibility: Acts as the parent route with path '/auth' and applies the Auth layout component.

Components.name: children routes
Components.responsibility: Defines individual pages for SignIn, ResetPassword, SignUp, EnterCode, EnterPassword and Invite under the auth path.

Functions.name: requiresNoAuth
Functions.purpose: Blocks access to auth pages if the user is already authenticated.

Functions.name: resetUser
Functions.purpose: Clears or resets any existing user state before entering certain auth routes.

Functions.name: checkUser
Functions.purpose: Verifies user existence or token validity before allowing access to code/password entry pages.

Functions.name: dynamic component import
Functions.purpose: Lazy-loads the Vue component for each child route via Webpack code-splitting.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main router configuration (e.g., in `router/index.js`) to register all '/auth' child routes within the application's route tree.
Notes: Uses bilingual titles in route metadata (en/ru).
Employs Webpack's `/* webpackChunkName */` for better chunk naming and lazy-loading.
Follows 'martyrs' framework conventions for middleware and route module structure.
